explanation:
### Hypemic Hypoxia 

Occurs when the blood's ability to carry oxygen is reduced due to a decrease in the amount or function of hemoglobin or other blood components, leading to inadequate oxygen delivery to the body's tissues. For example, smoking causes a reduction of function of hemoglobin.

### Histotoxic Hypoxia 

Occurs when the body's cells are unable to utilize oxygen even if it is adequately supplied, due to the presence of toxins or drugs that interfere with cellular respiration.

### Stagnant Hypoxia 

Occurs when there is a reduced blood flow to the body's tissues, resulting in inadequate oxygen supply due to conditions such as heart failure, shock, or circulatory obstruction.

### Hypoxic Hypoxia

Occurs when there is a reduced oxygen tension in the arterial blood, leading to inadequate oxygen supply to the body's tissues, often caused by conditions such as high altitude, lung disease, or carbon monoxide poisoning.

Which of the following statements about body temperature and its relevance to sleep patterns is correct?

options.text: The circadian variation in body temperature is the same for most people (who are adapted to the local time and work/sleep cycle). It is critical for determining the timing, duration and therefore quality of sleep.

The captain summarises: “We are almost at our crosswind limit; if you can see the runway, then we can make it.” The copilot knows that the captain is highly experienced in poor-weather flying. He perceives flashing lights, he/she believes that they could be the runway and, despite an initial uneasy feeling in his stomach, decides to make an approach to land.
This scenario is an example of

options.text: Risky shift; the tendency of both pilots to take more risk than any of them would on his/her own.
The copilot wanted to conform with the captain.
The captain allows the copilot to make the decision to improve his/her little experience in poor weather.
Group polarization (neither pilot wants to disagree with the other).
